my characters are just trying to protect the ones that are important to
them........simply that.....
----- Original Message -----
From: "Carnage darkness" <carnage_blood@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, May 01, 2000 10:14 AM
Subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars


> Carnage/ Dinobot
>
> ( Carnage: Just to let you know, Teltoli can not possibly see Dinobot
right
> now because he's inside the Ark. Sorry. And to CODE, worry about your own
> characters and not other peoples for a change.)
>
> * Carnage growled as she crouched low in the grass surrounding the Maximal
> base, she was only a few metres from Scourge and some other bot right now
> but her real goal was to get into the middle of the battle and not it's
> fringes. She looked behind her and saw Cyber Claw, it would be harder for
> the clone to get into the base and into a CR chamber now that there was a
> shield up.
> Carnage crept past Scourge and began to make her way deeper into the
battle,
> being hidden by the long grass was an actual advantage for her since she
was
> now picking out a suitable target.
> Suddenly she spotted one!
> It was a Predacon, didn't look too bright but a dumb look sometimes hid a
> clever bot indeed!
> She crept up to him and waited in the long grass for him to mosy on by, to
> her it almost seemed like a drone. (Tankoor)
> Carnage waited in the grass, just a little bit closer!*
>
> *****************************************************************
>
> * Dinobot watched as the charges from his rifle punctured the ventilation
> shaft, he was disappointed that he never hit his target but he had a lot
> more charges where that came from!
> He looked at the moving signature of his enemy as it moved towards the
> bridge, it was an advantage that if a bot had lost sight of his enemy he
> could always count on locating it's signature.
> Dinobot snarled as he slammed a new charge cartridge into the loading bay
of
> the rifle after taking out the old one, the empty charge cart clattered to
> the floor as he continued to follow hie target throughout the ship. He
aimed
> the rifle just ahead of the signature and let a mirage of charges go, he
> smiled to himself as they punctured the vent.
> Now he meant buisness!*
>
>
